What is NIST SP? ğŸŒ

The NIST Special Publications (SP) series is a set of documents developed by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) to provide guidance, standards, and best practices for information security, risk management, and IT governance.

Unlike the NIST Cybersecurity Framework, the SP series dives into detailed security controls, risk management, and compliance requirements. It is widely used by U.S. federal agencies, contractors, and organizations seeking structured, standards-based cybersecurity guidance.

What is NIST? ğŸŒ: The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) is a U.S. federal agency that develops standards, guidelines, and best practices to improve cybersecurity, risk management, and IT governance.

The NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) is one of its most widely adopted tools, designed to help organizations identify, protect, detect, respond, and recover from cybersecurity threats. It is flexible, scalable, and industry-agnostic, making it ideal for IT professionals across sectors.
